result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Terry W. Furlo

defendant.name: Furlo, Terry W.
defendant.address: N3352 Roaring Creek Road, Black River Falls, WI 54615

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: DV court.  First meeting.  He is a transfer from Rusk County.  Court advised defendant on expectations of DV court.  Contact T.M.
DA Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Defendant appeared with Attorney Poss.  Dismissed and read in in Rusk Co.  Dismiss this case.
copy of JOC from Rusk County Case No. 15CF10
Spoke with Attorney Poss and the DA and Attorney Poss agreed to remove the Status Conference and have this case read into the Russ County cases on Mr Furlo, where it can be read and dismissed.

Pre-trial conference at 08-26-2015 10:00 am.
Status conference at 09-14-2015 03:00 pm.
Court questioned defendant on his understanding of the waiver.  Defendant understood.  Court finds that the defendant waived the time limit for PH.  Bond continued.
records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: ADA Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Poss.  Waive reading of the complaint.  Defendant waived time limits for PH.  PTC set for 8/26 15 at STC 9/14/15 at 3 pm
DA Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Defendant appeared in custody.  Court recited the charge and possible penalties.  Defendant to contact SPD.  Bond set.  AIA set for 8/3/15 at 9:30 a.m.

Abide by all conditions of case 15CF10 Rusk Cty.  Defendant shall not consume any alcohol unless a physician states in writing that the defendant is alcohol dependent and complete withdrawal could endanger the defendant's health or life. In this case a doctor's excuse must be submitted to the Jackson County Clerk of Court or the Jackson County Jail within 48 hours of the bond being signed. Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, bar areas of restaurants, or where available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.
